title: The Only Oils That Will Make Your Hair Grow Faster, According To A Scalp Expert
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. Whether yourÂ hairÂ grows at a snailâ€™s pace or youâ€™re keen to treatÂ sparse patches, itâ€™s likely that in your quest forÂ thicker,Â longer lengths, you will have come across dozens of articles and tutorials extolling the virtues of many supposedly impressive ingredients. Thereâ€™s folic acid (also known as vitamin B9),Â castor oilÂ (now found in countless high street hair treatments) and TikTokâ€™s new favorite, rosemary oil (apparently like Miracle-Gro for your lengths). Just how many of these things are actually proven to work, and which ones rely solely on anecdotal evidence? We looked toÂ Hannah Gaboardi, trichologist atÂ The Hair Growth Clinic, andÂ Angela Onuoha, trichologist and cosmetic chemist, for their thoughts on the most Googled lotions, potions and natural ingredients touted to make your hair grow thicker and faster. DashDividers_1_500x100 What causes hair loss, thinning, and slow hair growth? Itâ€™s totally normal to lose hair (we tend to shed 50-100 strands a day, according to theÂ NHS) and usually itâ€™s nothing to be worried about â€” unless itâ€™s getting you down. Angela explains that stress is the number one cause of hair loss. â€œStress causes your body to constantly be in survival mode,â€ says Angela, â€œand that has a long-term effect on your hair, since it isnâ€™t prioritised by the body when it comes to survival.â€ But hair loss or thinning can often be a sign of aÂ medical condition, such as alopecia areata (unpredictable patches of hair loss). Weight loss, iron deficiency, polycystic ovary syndrome and illness are just a handful of other causes of hair loss and thinning. Itâ€™s best to visit your doctor or a registered trichologist for tailored advice. DashDividers_1_500x100 Is rosemary oil good for hair growth? On TikTok there are over 170.9K posts tagged underÂ #rosemaryoil, with the majority of videos talking about it in relation to hair health and accelerated growth. Hannah says she â€œswears byâ€ the ingredient for reducing hair fall, and lots ofÂ anecdotal evidenceÂ suggests that massagingÂ rosemary oilÂ into the scalp on a regular basis helps to fill out the hairline and encourages growth in sparse patches. But at the moment, itâ€™s just that â€” anecdotal. â€œSo far [the benefits of rosemary oil for hair growth have] not been scientifically proven on humans,â€ says Angela, referring toÂ a studyÂ on mice, where rosemary oil was used to speed up hair growth. Angela explains that there has been a human study, albeit only on 28 people, each one of whom had a scalp condition called alopecia areata (an autoimmune disorder which results in patchy hair loss). Hair loss caused by alopecia areata is very different from other types of hair loss or slow growth so the findings were limited. â€œSo far, when it comes to science there is no proof,â€ says Angela of rosemary oil. @thehealthyhur The girls who get it GET ITTTTT #greenscreen #hairloss #rosemarywater #rosemaryoil â™¬ Forever â€“ Labrinth All is not lost, though. It could be that the act of regularly massaging oil into the scalp is the catalyst that stimulates new hair cells. Hannah praisesÂ scalp massagersÂ in particular. â€œYou can use rosemary oil by massaging it into your scalp for five minutes and leaving it on for a minimum of 15 minutes,â€ she says. Hannah also rates rosemary oil for its antibacterial benefits for the scalp and hair. Plus, it can be very nourishing on dry hair strands. Thatâ€™s why brands likeÂ Pacifica,Â InnersenseÂ andÂ R+CoÂ are infusing it into shampoos and conditioners. When it comes to hair growth, however, the science just isnâ€™t there. DashDividers_1_500x100 Is castor oil good for hair growth? Castor oil is a vegetable oil derived from castor beans. It has highly moisturizing properties â€” particularly for natural hair, which tends to be drier â€” but Hannah and Angela agree that it will not stimulate hair growth. There is no scientific evidence to suggest otherwise, despite TikTok coming through withÂ countless anecdotes. If your hair is very dry, Hannah says that occasionally using castor oil can help maintain its health but the oil is notoriously thick and can create buildup, causing your lengths and scalp to become greasy quickly. If youâ€™re still swayed by the ingredient, try it in a pre-wash treatment designed to be used before shampoo to ensure the lather doesnâ€™t strip your hair and scalp completely, likeÂ Fable & Mane HoliRoots Hair Oil, $38. R29 also ratesÂ Shea Moisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Strengthen & Restore Hair Treatment Mask, $12.97, andÂ Philip Kingsley Elasticizer Deep Conditioning Treatment, $31, which are both rinse-off treatments and condition hair deeply. DashDividers_1_500x100 Are peptides good for hair growth? Peptides are little proteins, and proteins can regenerate both skin and hair. There are lots of different peptides, some that work on the hair and some that are better for the skin. In haircare, youâ€™re likely to hear a buzz around copper peptides and pea protein in particular. â€œCertain peptides fight inflammation,â€ explains Hannah. â€œWhen inflammation occurs on the scalp, it can impact the growth phase of your hair.â€ Some peptides can soothe this inflammation, nipping hair loss in the bud. Hannah rates pea peptides in particular for helping to smooth the hair follicle and providing fullness, making hair soft and shiny. â€œPea protein has essential vitamins and minerals, such as iron and calcium,â€ says Hannah, â€œwhich help boost hair quality and improve hair growth.â€Â She adds that the production of keratin, which makes hair strong, can be boosted with the help of pea protein. Not only will this repair the hair but it also promotes healthy new hairs and protects them from environmental aggressors like pollution and heat. TryÂ Philip Kingsley Density Thickening Protein Spray, $56, orÂ VIRTUE Flourish Density Booster, $50. Hannah is personally a fan ofÂ OUAI Scalp Serum, $52, which features acetyl tetrapeptide-3, whichÂ studiesÂ conclude increases hair growth. R29 also ratesÂ The Ordinary Multi-Peptide Serum For Hair Density, $22.80, which boasts multiple peptides and caffeine to boost hair density. The incredible reviews speak for themselves. DashDividers_1_500x100 Is argan oil good for hair growth? Studies show thatÂ argan oilÂ is effective at protecting hair from damage caused by environmental aggressors such as pollution and UV. Itâ€™s why youâ€™ll spot the ingredient in so many hair products. But just like castor oil, there is hardly any data to suggest that it helps with hair growth. For smooth, protected hair, opt instead for a leave-in conditioner containing argan oil, such asÂ HASK Argan Oil 5 in 1 Leave in Conditioner, $6.97. If your hair needs more moisture, treat your strands (not your scalp) to something likeÂ OGX Renewing+ Argan Oil of Morocco Penetrating Oil, $10.69, before styling or air-drying. It makes hair soft and smooth. Angela agrees that using an oil to lock in moisture is the perfect way to give a nice coating to your hair, preventing damage. â€œIt also makes the hair easier to manage,â€ she says, â€œand gives it an amazing shine. I personally love theÂ Rhyme & Reason Argan Oil Smooth Finishing Serum, $12.80, since itâ€™s super lightweight but so nourishing.â€ DashDividers_1_500x100 Is minoxidil good for hair growth? You mightâ€™ve come across minoxidil in your hair growth endeavors. As it stands, this is one of the onlyÂ scientifically provenÂ ingredients to stimulate hair growth and, happily, itâ€™s available in various high street drugstores,Â as well as online. So what exactly is it? â€œMinoxidil is a vasodilator,â€ explains Angela, â€œand this means that it widens the blood vessels to deliver more oxygen-rich blood to the hair follicles.â€ Angela adds that lots of people who are dealing with hair loss need more oxygen to the affected areas to stimulate hair growth. She says that minoxidil is used to spot-treat areas of baldness or a receding hairline, since it stimulates those areas and slows down further balding. Itâ€™s the active ingredient in the popular over-the-counter productÂ Rogaine. DashDividers_1_500x100 Is folic acid good for hair growth? Hannah says that folic acid â€” also known as vitamin B9 â€” is necessary for hair health. Angela explains that it is found in our food, such as spinach, beans, peas, citrus fruit, liver and grains. Unless youâ€™re deficient in the vitamin, youâ€™re probably getting enough from your diet. â€œEverything that youâ€™re adding to your diet will end up in your pee,â€ says Angela of hair growth supplements which contain folic acid. â€œYour body only absorbs what it needs.â€ If youâ€™re worried about deficiency, Angela suggests getting your bloodwork checked before self-diagnosing the condition of your hair using supplements. The same goes forÂ biotin (or vitamin B7). â€œThere has been a huge trend for biotin in hair growth recently,â€ says Angela. â€œThe funny thing is, Iâ€™ve never had a client who ended up having a biotin deficiency. In fact, humans rarely have it.â€ DashDividers_1_500x100 Is washing your hair regularly good for hair growth? Hannah believes that using a shampoo regularly helps to keep the scalp clean. In turn, removing oil and debris from the scalp can promote hair growth. Angela agrees that starting off with good scalp health â€” and particularly a clean scalp â€” is key. â€œSince the scalp is the soil your hair grows on, you want it to be in the best healthy state,â€ she explains. Angela likes a gentle cleanser likeÂ Rhyme & Reason Nourish & Gloss Shampoo, $7.88. â€œThis contains hyaluronic acid, which is an amazing ingredient to keep the scalp moisturized and supple,â€ she says. If your hair is dry and damaged by heat, bleach or dye, tryÂ Rhyme & Reason Repair & Restore Shampoo, $10.99. Lastly, a leave-in conditioner is key to make sure your hair stays moisturized between washes, says Angela. She likesÂ Rhyme & Reason Quench & Curl Leave In Conditioner, $9.99, for curly hair. R29 also ratesÂ Sol de Janeiro Brazilian Joia Milky Leave-in Conditioner, $28, orÂ Aussie Hair Insurance Leave In Hair Conditioner Spray, $5.99, if youâ€™re on a budget. title: I Tried Sabrina Carpenter's Espresso Perfume - It's Just as Addictive as Her Hit Song
description: Oh to bottle up the way Sabrina Carpenter's "Espresso" made me feel this summer. The radio domination! The endless memes! Me neurotically murmuring the track's nonsense chorus all day: "That's that me espresso." (I'm still trying to unpack whatever that line means.) Alas, as summer 2024's unofficial anthem, not only did the ballad top my Spotify Wrapped reports, it also accompanied some of my fondest memories of the year. And as 2024 comes to a close, Carpenter is helping nostalgia-starved fans tap into memories inspired by the hit song with a perfume that pays homage to its caffeine-infused roots. Scent Beauty's Me Espresso Eau de Parfum ($60) is the latest in a long line of fragrance collaborations between the pop star and perfume brand, though I'd argue this launch might be their most decadent to date. Much like her "Espresso" song, Carpenter's Espresso Perfume plays into a sweet yet sultry vibe, with rich notes like cocoa powder and espresso bean that are so evocative, they'll have you feeling like you were steeped in a pool of Italian dark roast. Ahead, I break down what this new Sabrina Carpenter perfume smells like, how it compares to other celebrity fragrances, and why the mocha mousse color trend might hint at it being 2025's hottest scent. About Sabrina Carpenter's Espresso Perfume This perfume features notes of espresso bean, cocoa powder, vanilla orchid, sugared amber, and jasmine, among others. It's available in one 2.5 ounce size. The perfume is one of several that have been created through Sabrina Carpenter's partnership with Scent Beauty; others include a Sweet Tooth Cherry Baby Perfume and Sweet Tooth Caramel Perfume. What I Like About Sabrina Carpenter's Espresso Perfume Given that my fragrance preferences tend to lean toward notes like smoky vanilla or sandalwood, I was admittedly skeptical before trying this Scent Beauty perfume. I've always found that caffeine- or food-scented fragrances bordered between being delicious and downright tacky; hence why I was so surprised to find that this pop star-approved perfume smells... rather delightful. While it's infused with decadent notes like cocoa powder and espresso bean, the scent is heavy on its jasmine fragrance (a welcome surprirse) while lighter fragrances like vanilla and amber help to balance the aroma out. Carpenter's perfume is sweet without being overwhelming, with a balminess that reminds me of a powdery, brown-sugar latte as opposed to a stark espresso scent. While I'm less of an expert on fragrance-layering, other shoppers - namely reviewers on Scent Beauty's site - also claim that it's a fantastic perfume to layer with other scents. One user even wrote: "I love wearing it by itself but I sprayed a lavender vanilla body spray on top and it was heavenly! Like a vanilla lavender latte!" Another thing that I really appreciate about this espresso perfume is its long-lasting scent. A little goes a long way: I usually only need a spritz or two on my wrists and neck in order to really lock in the fragrance, then I'm good for the rest of the day. I've also received endless compliments since I started wearing the perfume, many coming hours after I first sprayed it - another testament to its longevity. Plus, with the mocha mousse color trend predicted to dominate 2025, I'm convinced this espresso perfume might wind up being the year's hottest fragrance. What to Consider Before Trying Sabrina Carpenter's Espresso Perfume As far as celebrity perfumes go, this fragrance is pricier than some other market options (for example, Ariana Grande's Cloud Perfume and Kylie Jenner's Kylie Fragrance retail for about $48). But based off of its unique scent and long-lasting smell, I'd say that it's worth the price. If you're in the market for something more affordable, you can shop out other celebrity perfumes or fragrances with similar espresso scents. Where Is Sabrina Carpenter's Espresso Perfume Available? This celebrity perfume is available to shop at Scent Beauty. title: 8 Best Glitter Nail Polishes, Hand Picked by Experts
description: Shiny, lustrous nails have dominated the beauty world in recent years, largely due to Hailey Bieber's iconic glazed-doughnut era and the expertise of her go-to nail artist, Zola Ganzorigt. That signature glossy sheen sparked a wave of nail trends like chrome finishes, jelly-glaze effects, and pearlescent polishes. This season, however, glitter nail polish is taking center stage - and it's more versatile than ever. The catch? Not all glitter formulations are created equal. The best options go beyond just sparkle, offering smooth application, quick-drying formulas, and chip-resistant, long-lasting wear. With a range of choices, from traditional lacquers that you can find at the drugstore to gel-based formulas that deliver a salon-quality finish, there's a glitter polish for everyone. To narrow it down, professionals and beauty editors carefully evaluated and reviewed the most popular options on the market. Standout features like texture, durability, and vibrant glitter payoff were looked at, ensuring these picks deliver on both style and staying power. Whether it's a subtle shimmer layered over an opaque base color or a bold, full-coverage glitter moment, ahead, check out the best glitter nail polishes available. According to the professionals, these polishes are worth your money and will elevate any manicure this season.
